text: The 2015 Orienteering World Cup was the 21st edition of the Orienteering World Cup. The 2015 Orienteering World Cup consisted of 11 events, all individual competitions. The events were located in Australia, Norway, Sweden, United Kingdom and Switzerland. The 2015 World Orienteering Championships in Inverness, Scotland, United Kingdom was included in the World Cup. Daniel Hubmann of Switzerland won his second consecutive overall title in the men's World Cup, his sixth title in total. Tove Alexandersson of Sweden won her second overall title in the women's World Cup. ==Events== ===Men=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 90%" |- !width="20"| !width="130"| Venue !width="140"| Distance !width="70"| Date !width="200"| Winner !width="200"| Second !width="200"| Third !width="20"| |- !
